articles.title: WHO Praises China as Country That Deserves 'Gratitude and Respect' As Some Question Coronavirus Transparency
articles.description: The WHO director-general credited China's efforts for the prevention of more cases breaking out in other countries.
articles.content:
The World Health Organization (WHO) is standing firmly behind China as people continue to question whether the country mishandled releasing information about the new coronavirus strain.

articles.author: Rosie McCall
articles.title: Genetically Engineered Male Moths Released into Wild to Wipe Out Females
articles.description: Scientists have completed what they say is the first-ever open-field release of a genetically-modified insect. Genetically-modified insects could one day be used as an alternative to pesticide.
articles.content:
Scientists have released male moths genetically engineered with a destruct gene into the wild to wipe out females. They say is the first open-field release of a self-limiting diamondback moth.
The study's authors describe it as "an exciting next step" and "a… [+4742 chars]

articles.title: Outrage at Bar Offering Corona Beer Deals During Coronavirus Outbreak Caused by 'Snowflakes,' Says Owner
articles.description: The House on the Hood bar in Hamilton, New Zealand, was accused of "shameful marketing" as it advertised a promotion on Corona beers linking it with the coronavirus.
articles.content:
A bar in New Zealand has dismissed accusations on social media that it was being flippant about the deadly coronavirus outbreak, by offering a promotion on Corona beers "while the pandemic lasts."

articles.title: India Government Tells Citizens to Use Homeopathy to Treat China Coronavirus
articles.description: Press Information Bureau suggests people treat symptoms by rubbing alternative medicines into their chest, scalp and nostrils.
articles.content:
India's government has promoted pseudoscientific homeopathic practices in its effort to prevent the spread of the mysterious new coronavirus, which has killed over 100 people.

articles.description: United has suspended dozens of flights to China, while the airline (along with Delta and American Airlines) has also issued travel waivers for those on schedule to travel on any affected routes.
